text: Kishore Singh Rathore (born 27 April 1969) is a Nepali politician and a member of the House of Representatives of the federal parliament of Nepal. He was elected under the proportional representation system from Nepali Congress filling the reserved seat for Khas-Arya group. He is also a member of the House Finance Committee. In the shadow cabinet of Nepali Congress, he is the coordinator of the Ministry of Sports and Youth Affairs. ==Political career== He joined politics as a student in 1984, from Nepal Student Union, the student wing of Nepali Congress. He became the Free Student Union secretary and then Chairman while he was in Trichandra College. He went on to become secretary of Nepal Student Union, and then chairman for six years. He was also the founding chair of FSU Forum. Later, he went on to become central member of Nepali Congress. He was a candidate from Bardiya-4 for Nepali Congress, in the Second constituent assembly election of 2013. ==Personal life== He was born on 27 April 1969 to Mahendra Bahadur Singh and Indira Singh in Wadagaun, Salyan. His family later moved to the Terai and currently lives in Rajapur, Bardiya. He has a son and a daughter. ==References== Category:Living people Category:Nepali Congress politicians Category:Members of the House of Representatives (Nepal) Category:1969 births
title: Kishore Singh Rathore
